newsitem.title: LUXEMBOURG: Court says Belgium late to enact rules on medical devices.
newsitem.headline: Court says Belgium late to enact rules on medical devices.

text.p: The European Court of Justice found Belgium late to enact Community rules on medical devices.
Belgium did not deny the European Commission's claims, but told the court a draft royal decree designed to implement the directive on medical devices is currently being finalised by a working party.
The court strictly construes time limits laid down in directives and found Belgium failed to fulfil its member state obligations by missing the deadline.
"Failure to fulfil member state obigations - Medical devices
Commission of the European Communities, applicant

application for a declaration that by failing to adopt, within the prescribed time limit, the laws, regulations and administrative provisions necessary to comply with Council directive 93/42/EEC of 14 June 1993 concerning medical devices (OJ 1993 L 169, p. 1), the Kingdom of Belgium has failed to fulfil its obligations under the EC Treaty

1. Declares that by failing to adopt, within the prescribed time limit, the laws, regulations and administrative provisions necessary to comply with Council directive 93/42/EEC of 14 June 1993 concerning medical devices (OJ 1993 L 169, p. 1), the Kingdom of Belgium has failed to fulfil its obligations under the EC Treaty
2. Orders the Kingdom of Belgium to pay the costs.
